meanings.definition: A crust or hard outer layer on food.
meanings.sent1: The croute on the apple pie was crunchy and delicious.
meanings.sent2: I always remove the croute from my toast before eating it.
meanings.sent3: The croute on the pizza was so tough, it could be used as a frisbee!
meanings.sent4: The croute of frost on the window sparkled in the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The croute on the fried chicken was perfectly golden and crispy.

meanings.definition: A piece of bread or pastry that has been toasted or fried until crisp.
meanings.sent1: The croute of the garlic bread was the best part of the meal.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure to toast the croute just right for her sandwiches.
meanings.sent3: The croute on the croissant was so crispy, it sounded like a symphony when bitten into.
meanings.sent4: The croute of the pastry flaked off with each bite, leaving a trail of crumbs.
meanings.sent5: The croute on the baguette was perfectly crunchy and golden brown.

meanings.definition: A hard, outer layer or covering on something.
meanings.sent1: The croute of ice on the pond was thick enough to skate on.
meanings.sent2: The croute of dust on the old book made it difficult to read the title.
meanings.sent3: The croute of paint on the wall was chipping away, revealing the original color underneath.
meanings.sent4: The croute of moss on the rock made it look like a tiny green carpet.
meanings.sent5: The croute of rust on the metal gate gave it a weathered appearance.
